task.title: Task: Make Table query
task.shortdesc: Creating a new table with the Make Table query.

context.p: The marketing department has a special offer for all customers in Friesland. For this they need a table with only the customer data for customers in the province Friesland.
All necessary data is in table Customers. Selecting for Friesland can be done with a criterion in the query. First you need to create this select query and then change the query type to Make Table.

step.cmd: Choose tab Create Query Design (group Queries) .
step.stepresult:
Access creates a new blank query window and displays the dialog box Show Table. Dialog box Show Table
Dialog box show table

step.cmd: Add table Customers and then click Close.
step.stepresult: The table has been added to the query window.

step.cmd: Add all fields by double-clicking on the asterisk (*) and then add separate again the field Province.
Enter as criterion "FR" for the field Province and don't show this extra field, because it is in fact already shown by Customers.
Check the output of the query with the Datasheet View.
Save the query with name Customers Friesland.
Open query in Design View and click Make Table (group Query Type) .
step.stepresult: The dialog box Make Table is displayed.

step.cmd: Name the new table Friesland customers and select that this table should come in the current database.

A dialog box asking whether the changes should be saved.This is because the query type has been changed. This is also seen in the navigation pane under Queries. The query icon indicates an action query:
